alert.note: Alert for Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 26 at 4:19AM PST until February 26 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW TO IMPACT STEVENS PASS... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Accumulations between 10 and 15 inches for Stevens Pass and higher terrain. Accumulations of 2 to 6 inches for elevations below 4000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph creating blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Stevens Pass, Stehekin, and Holden Village. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on very difficult travel, especially Sunday morning. Moderate to heavy snow combined with strong winds will result in significant visibility reductions from blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates of one inch per hour are expected at times Sunday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
